title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 9 February - BBC News
summary: duke of cambridge to visit leicestershire .
mahrez to return to leicester training .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: the east midlands live page has now finished for the week .
some stories may still continue to appear on this feed but full updates wo n't resume until 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: weather : cold with strengthening winds
text: tonight will be dry and cold with mainly clear skies , although cloud is likely to start to spread from the west later in the night and the winds will strengthen .
it will be a windy , milder and mostly cloudy day on saturday with spells of heavy rain pushing in from the west during the morning and then persisting through the afternoon .
sunday will be cold and windy with periods of sunshine and localised snow flurries .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: house fire is out
text: a fire at a house in fradley close , bulwell , is out , emergency services have confirmed .
no injuries have been reported .
fire officers said crews had `` done well to stop it spreading '' through the row of houses .

documents.title: parents face school parking fine
text: parents with children at a primary school in braunstone town could face getting fined if they drive to drop off or up their child .
from april leicestershire county council will enforce a `` school clear zone '' at millfield l.e.a.d academy - this means there will be parking restrictions in place on roads around the school .
these roads will be patrolled by civil enforcement officers issuing fines of £ 70 or £ 35 if paid within 14 days .
it follows a `` catalogue of parking issues '' on surrounding residential roads , including one incident where parked vehicles hindered an ambulance 's access to the school .
the school receives regular calls from both residents and parents and carers raising concerns about the parking of vehicles on the roads surrounding the school .
we have regularly requested that vehicles are parked safely , but the situation seems to have deteriorated , so we support any actions which improve things . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: mahrez will 'continue to give his all ' for foxes
text: riyad mahrez has released a statement about his recent absence from the leicester city squad .
the foxes player has trained with the club for the first time since his request to move to manchester city last month was rejected .
over the past 10 days many people claiming to be my friend have spoken about me and things they know nothing about .
leicester city football club were always aware of my whereabouts and had knowledge of my thinking either directly or via my advisors .
my goals have always been the same and i have always given my full 100 % when i play for the club , the fans and my teammates .
those goals remain the same today and in the future and when i am asked to be a part of the leicester team , rest assured i will continue to give my all ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: house fire in bulwell
text: firefighters are tackling a blaze on fradley close in bulwell - more to follow .
firefigthers from # stockhill , # ashfield , # londonroad and # hucknall are currently fighting a house fire on # fradleyclose , bulwell .
crews are currently using 4 breathing apparatus , 2 hose reels , 1 jet and an aerial ladder platform to fight the fire .
# redwatchcontrol
stay safe guys x
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: car stolen from carer with cancer
text: a man with cancer , who cares for his wife and 91-year-old mother , has been left without a means of transport after his car was stolen in newark .
when michael dawson popped into his mother 's house to up her shopping list yesterday he left the car keys in the ignition .
the keys were gone and the car was locked when he came out .
thieves came back later , took the car and drove it into a wall .
nottinghamshire police believe two men fled the scene of the crash .
the force is appealing for anyone with information to contact them .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: fourth man charged with stabbing murder
text: fourth man charged with stabbing murder

documents.title: mahrez criticises 'untrue assumptions '
text: mahrez criticises 'untrue assumptions '

documents.title: watch : cctv appeal following burglary
text: police are appealing for help to identify the men in this cctv footage following a burglary at a cosmetic store in oadby .
the shop on mandervell road was broken into between 23:00 and 23:30 on 29 january .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: prince to visit hinckley motorcycle manufacturer
text: it looks like hinckley is about to get a royal visitor

the duke of cambridge will visit triumph motorcycles and mira technology park in warwickshire on tuesday 20th february , for a day that celebrates world-class british vehicular manufacture , research and development .
he should sign up for the race on the isle of man .
he can ride my 1971 norton 750 commando .
sounds like a nice day out for him .
will he be taking the flying taxi ?
my hobby is reading , i think reading is good for study is make easy for learning
wan t this guy to be next ruler
is he going to get a speed triple ?
good choice .

the duke of cambridge will visit triumph motorcycles and mira technology park in warwickshire on tuesday 20th february , for a day that celebrates world-class british vehicular manufacture , research and development .
hiding tweets again
awesome
neat .
always get proper training before riding a motorcycle .
my spouse is a motorcycle safety instructor at a college in the usa where we live .
worth the time & money .
it saves lives & teaches mature riding skills .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: man carried 2ft machete through shopping centre
text: a 19-year-old man has been sentenced to six months in a young offenders ' institute after being caught carrying a 2ft ( 0.6m ) machete through a nottingham shopping centre .
giovanni campbell , from stock well in bulwell , took the weapon inside the victoria centre on wednesday afternoon following a fight in the car park outside .
at nottingham magistrates ' court this morning the teenager admitted possession of a bladed article .
he claimed the machete was for `` self-defence '' as he had previously been a victim of knife crime .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: underground cable caused 'bang '
text: a street cordon in city centre derby has been reduced following earlier concerns over a suspected gas leak .
emergency services evacuated shops on east street but gas company cadent said the pipe was `` fine '' and it has now passed the matter on to electricity workers .
western power distribution confirmed a fault on an underground cable had caused a `` loud bang '' and raised a paving slab .
`` no properties have lost power and we have engineers on site carrying out repairs , '' the company said .

documents.title: prisoner death 'will affect community '
text: the independent monitoring board ( imb ) for nottingham prison has said it is `` shocked and saddened '' to hear of the death of darren capewell .
the 37-year-old inmate died at hmp nottingham on wednesday .
the imb is made up of members of the public that visit the prison to monitor standards of care .
in a statement , the board said : `` darren was well-known to many prisoners , staff and board members , and his death will affect many people in the prison community . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: man admits 'brutal ' killing
text: a man has received an indeterminate hospital order after admitting killing a man at his derby home .
glenn bullock , 52 , of meynell street , normanton , admitted the manslaughter of murrey paulson on july 19 last year at derby crown court .
det ch insp gareth meadows , from derbyshire police , said : `` this was a particularly brutal attack .
my thoughts are again with murrey 's family at this time . ''
mr paulson 's brother said : `` our lives have to continue without our wonderful brother , son , uncle and friend . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: police find absconded prisoner
text: police have found a man who failed to return to an open prison following a work placement on wednesday .
mathias lescott absconded from hmp sudbury , in derbyshire , after being given temporary leave .
he has now been arrested and detained in stoke-on-trent .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: south korean woman 'thrilled ' by olympic unity
text: a south korean woman who now lives in nottinghamshire has said she is `` thrilled '' about a show of unity between her homeland and their neighbours north korea .
during the winter olym opening ceremony , athletes from north korea and the south korean host nation paraded beneath the same flag .
inkyung chung , who now lives in lady bay , west bridgford , said the joint march was a `` positive step '' .
she said : `` we 're always hoping that , one day , we will become one country . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: driver sentenced after high-speed chase
text: driver sentenced after high-speed chase

documents.title: woman reunites owners with lost pets
text: a woman in melton mowbray has made it her mission to reunite lost pets with their owners .
in the past three years wendy grey claims to have tracked down between 200-300 cats and dogs .
she 's also helped locate lost horses , pigs and even a tortoise .
wendy is a volunteer for the charity harvey 's army which has recruits all over the uk .
when she is notified about a lost creature she heads out with a scanner that can read pet microchips .
wendy said helping people to get their animals back means `` everything '' to her .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: crash on the a52 eastbound
text: derbyshire police have tweeted
# a52 eastbound j25 m1 .
driver states suffered a medical episode and drifted off the carriageway .
minor injuries to driver and two passengers .
on slip is closed for recovery work .
dvla driver medical dept and @ twitterid licencing notified .
# highways
good job he had medical then .
designed to prevent this avoidable incident .
a medical ?
for a taxi badge ?
yes it 's the law .
and they cost between £ 40 and £ 120 depending on where you get it done .
they 're not `` the law '' .
local council rules maybe .
certainly not required here .
well at least for the erewash area `` pass a medical examination under group 2 medical standards , undertaken by your own doctor '' different areas my have different criteria
all derby taxi drivers have to have a medical by their own gp .
how about everyone hopes he 's all right rather than blaming anyone
good .
i did n't know you were able to report medical issues to the dvla ?
that 's good .
give him dipps and revoke his taxi badge !
@ twitterid that 's what we saw earlier
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: extra patrols following park disturbance
text: expect to see extra police patrols in this area of stapleford over the weekend .
nottinghamshire police said they would be enforcing a dispersal order after a disturbance at hicklings lane recreation ground last saturday .
as well as more patrols , officers will use powers to disperse anyone in the area they feel is likely to cause crime or disorder .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: phone box 'gas leak ' closes city street
text: part of east street in derby has been cordoned off and nearby shops have been evacuated after a suspected gas leak was discovered under a phone box .
the leak was discovered at 12:30 and emergency services and a gas company are on site .
it is unclear when the street might reopen .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: crash on link road from m1 to a52
text: motorists - this might cause you some issues
the link road from the # m1 at j25 onto the # a52 eastbound remains closed for on-going vehicle recovery following an earlier collision .
@ twitterid are on scene .
once recovery is done we 'll let you know .
i guess that by `` link road '' you mean slip road as there is n't a link road there as such .
also is it the m1 exit slip or a52 eastbound entry slip ?
# thehelpisinthedetail
hi paul , you can still get off the m1 but you can not exit onto the a52 eastbound .
often referred to as a link as its the slip that links the m1 j25 to the a52 eastbound .
thanks .
5th incident this week between 24 & 25 .
we do n't need smart motorways , we need smart drivers
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: hindu temple ditches single-use plastic
text: a hindu temple in leicester has found a new way to reduce the amount of plastic it throws away .
the community centre at jalaram prarthana mandal on narborough road feeds up to 1,000 people every week .
until now , they 've served food on single-use plastic plates .
now they have invested in harder wearing plastic trays , plates and cutlery that can all be washed and reused .
sunil budheo said he was inspired by sir david attenborough 's tv series , blue planet ll .
he said : `` when i saw the damage it was doing it stirred up an emotion in me .
that inspired me to come up with an idea .
at the end of the day it 's a planet for all of us and i wanted to do something . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: man struck by car on zebra crossing in leicester
text: a 61-year-old man has been taken to hospital with `` non life-threatening '' injuries after being hit by a car in leicester last night .
the pedestrian was struck on st peter 's road at about 18:30 while he was walking over a zebra crossing .
leicestershire police said officers are carrying out house-to-house enquiries and looking at cctv footage .
the force is also appealing for anyone who was in the area and saw what happened to get in touch with them .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: hull trains affected by damage to overhead wires
text: following on from our earlier story about delays on the east coast main line because of damage to power lines , we 've just been made aware of this :
the 11:48 london king 's cross to hull , due 14:16 , will no longer call at retford .
this is due to damage to the overhead electric wires .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: loughborough lightning to go head to head
text: loughborough lightning to go head to head

documents.title: shops evacuated after possible gas leak
text: derbyshire fire and rescue service is advising people to avoid the east street area in derby following reports of a possible gas leak .
police are also in attendance and have told the bbc some surrounding shops have been evacuated while the gas board deals with the issue .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: schmeichel : 'puel has changed how we play '
text: leicester city goalkeeper kasper schmeichel has spoken of the impact of manager claude puel on the foxes ' style of play .
author: Football Focus

documents.title: loughborough lightning team-mates to go head to head
text: loughborough lightning team-mates to go head to head

documents.title: rugby : tigers name starting xv
text: telusa veainu returns , as does manu tuilagi
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: appeal to find missing bulwell man
text: police in nottingham say they are concerned for ian morris after he was reported missing from the bulwell area on wednesday .
the force is asking anyone who has seen mr morris to contact them .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: further death at prison confirmed
text: the ministry of justice has confirmed there 's been another death at nottingham prison .
a prison service spokesperson said 37-year-old darren capewell died in custody on wednesday .
it follows a spate of deaths last year when five inmates died in the space of one month .
there will now be an independent investigation by the prisons and probation ombudsman .
earlier this year the bbc reported claims workers at hmp nottingham were stopping stop two suicide attempts every week .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: new swimming complex 'will create jobs '
text: up to 78 full-time staff will be employed at derby 's new £ 33m moorways swimming complex which is scheduled to open in 2020 .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: food company recalls meat
text: a nottingham-based food business has decided to recall a number of its meats after its supplier was inspected .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: woman trapped in car following crash
text: nottinghamshire police have tweeted
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: village pub doubles up as library
text: for punters who fancy up some pinter with their pints or some marlow with their merlot , a leicestershire pub might have the answer .
for croxton kerrial 's village local - the geese and fountain - is also operating as a library during daytime hours .
owners nick holden and kate ahrens are self-confessed `` book lovers '' and have 1,400 tomes from their own collection around the pub for people to browse and borrow .

nick said : `` it 's quite nice to have to contrast between being a busy pub in the evening , with lots of noise and talking going on , then during the day we 're a library and get to hush everybody . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: care home to open at former thorntons factory
text: work is due to start on a 40-bed care home and library on a derelict factory site in derbyshire .
the development at the former thorntons factory , which will start in april , will cost £ 9.8m and is expected to be completed by summer 2019 .
jean wharmby , the county council 's cabinet member for adult care , said the new `` state-of-the-art '' building would be a great addition to the town .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: mahrez return 'unlikely '
text: despite riyad mahrez 's return to training , it 's unlikely he will be available for selection for the game against manchester city in the premier league on saturday .
the algerian has n't played since 20 january when a proposed move to city fell through .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: nursery owner refutes ofsted claims
text: the owner of a nursery that had its licence suspended by ofsted has refuted claims that `` children may be at risk of harm '' .
sarah waller , who owns the darcy bunnie creative arts nursery , hilton , said the situation is now `` in the hands of lawyers '' .
she added : `` parents have been amazing over this and are as upset as we are .
we hope to be back in the bunny house very soon . ''
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: bus stop murderer 's sentence cut again
text: bus stop murderer 's sentence cut again

documents.title: 'super crossing ' work to start in city
text: work is about to begin on creating a new `` super crossing '' at vaughan way in leicester , allowing cyclists and pedestrians to access the developing waterside area from the city centre .

the plans form part of a £ 50m redevelopment project by the city council that will also see the construction of two new hotels , office space and `` public space '' in the area of great central street .
this road will no longer be open to traffic .
another part of the project is to refurbish the old great central station which has been empty for almost 40 years .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: witnesses to car theft sought
text: two men who may have witnessed a car theft are being sought by police .

officers have released a photo of the men whom they believe may have seen a man in his late 20s push an 80-year-old woman to the ground before taking her car keys as she left the co-op in chapel street , kirkby-in-ashfield , on 27 january at around 07:35 .
the suspect is described as white , in his late 20s and around 5ft 6ins tall .
a 32-year-old man was arrested in connection with the incident and released under investigation .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: police investigate suspected illegal killing of a fox
text: police have begun an investigation after reports that a fox was killed illegally in melton country park .
author: Melton Times

documents.title: dead fish found after cyanide spillage
text: paul reeves from the environment agency has tweeted this morning
sadly , a number of fish have been found dead in adams pond # heanor this morning .
@ twitterid officers continue to monitoring water quality .
yes , we believe so unfortunately
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: portable toilet blaze investigated
text: emergency services say they are investigating the cause of a blaze on at lowmoor industrial estate last night that took place in several portable toilets , a shipping container and an lgv trailer .
five crews spent several hours tackling the fire , which is believed to have started at 22.23 .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: your a dusting of snow
text: there 's been a smattering of snow across the region , and our bbc weather watchers have been busy uploading images of it .
les at large took this in wolverhampton .
this is the scene in ludlow , shropshire taken by foggy .
peter steggles took this in longnor , shropshire .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: living in 'a piece of heaven ' since 1928
text: living in 'a piece of heaven ' since 1928

documents.title: commuters warned of tram delays
text: worth noting if you are heading to catch the tram this morning .
service information : we currently have some delayed services on the toton - hucknall line following an incident on chilwell road .
wait times are between 7 and 15 minutes , and our control room will work on reforming full time table as soon as possible .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: speed-skaters get started
text: nottingham-based short-track speed skaters will be among the first competitors as the winter olym gets under way in south korea .
elise christie and charlotte gilmartin take part in qualifying for the 500m tomorrow morning .
the rest of the team , kathryn thompson , farrell treacy and mapperley 's josh cheetham , all begin their bids for medals next week .
performance director stewart laing said the city was central to the skaters ' success .
`` nottingham is one of only two cities in britain that has two elite training centres for world-class programmes , '' he said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: knee injury ends season for winnall
text: knee injury ends season for winnall

documents.title: man is fighting to have five-stone hernia removed
text: a devastated doorman is fighting to have a five stone hernia removed after being told it can not be operated on despite him losing weight .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: man due before magistrates over victoria centre fight
text: a teenager is due before magistrates later after a fight involving masked gangs in nottingham .
the police were called to a group of 10 to 15 people in and around the victoria centre car park on wednesday evening .
a 19-year-old from bulwell is charged with possession of an offensive weapon .
a 17-year-old boy thought to have been injured in the incident has been released from hospital .
author: Lewis Scrimshaw
BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: derby county 's on-loan striker suffers season-ending injury
text: sam winnall will play no further part in derby county 's promotion push after suffering a cruciate ligament injury .
he announced his season is over on instagram after having an operation on thursday .

the striker , on-loan from sheffield wednesday , said : `` unfortunately i have torn my acl and will be missing for the rest of the season and beyond - i 'd like to personally thank derby county on how amazing they 've treated me through the process . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: regional paper owner buys express titles for £ 126m
text: trinity mirror , the newspaper group which owns titles including the nottingham post , the derby telegraph and the leicester mercury , as well as the daily mirror , has agreed to buy another publishing company .
the group is to pay £ 126.7m for the publishing assets of northern & shell , the company behind titles including the daily express , the daily star and magazines such as ok !
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: derbyshire nursery has licence suspended
text: a children 's nursery in derbyshire has had its licence suspended by ofsted because children may be placed at risk of harm .
ofsted says it intends to cancel the registration of darcy bunnie creative arts nursery on main street in hilton meaning it can no longer provide childcare .
it says it no longer believes the nursery can meet the `` prescribed requirements for registration '' , but ca n't give any more details at this stage .
at the nursery 's last inspection - in january 2017 - it was rated `` good '' in all areas .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: living in 'a piece of heaven ' since 1928
text: health professionals have spoken of their love of a `` very independent '' and `` feisty '' woman who lived on the same farm since the 1920s .
olive harvey was at stocking farm in derbyshire - described as `` a piece of heaven '' - since 1928 .
author: BBC Inside Out

documents.title: traffic delays across the region
text: - the m1 heading northbound between j21a , a46 ( leicester north ) and j22 is backed up due to a lane closure .
- there 's heavy congestion on the a50 ( shardlow ) towards the m1 due to roadworks just before j24 .
- markeaton island , derby is backed up heading southbound on the a38 .
- temporary traffic lights on the a6 at kibworth , leicestershire are causing delays in the area .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a cold and wet start to the day with a chance of some snow over higher ground later .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for our live coverage
text: hello and good morning .
amy woodfield and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
have a great day - hope you 've got that friday feeling !
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News
